= Oscillations =

== TL;DR ==

*Simple harmonic motion*
{{$
x = A\cos{\omega t}
}}$

*Period, and frequency*
{{$
T = \frac{2\pi}{\omega},~~
f = \frac{1}{T} = \frac{\omega}{2\pi}
}}$

*Equation of motion of simple harmonic oscillator*
{{$
ma = -kx
}}$

*Angular frequency, period, and energy of simple harmonic oscillator*
{{$
\omega = \sqrt{\frac{k}{m}},~~
T = 2\pi\sqrt{\frac{m}{k}},~~
E = \frac{1}{2}kA^2
}}$

*Angular frequency and period of simple pendulum*
{{$
\omega = \sqrt{\frac{g}{l}},~~
T = 2\pi\sqrt{\frac{l}{g}}
}}$


== Simple Harmonic Motion ==

{{$
x = A\,\mathrm{cos}(\omega t)
}}$

Where $A$ is the amplitude and $\omega$ is the angular frequency.

*Period*
{{$
T = \frac{2\pi}{\omega}
}}$

*Frequency*
{{$
f = \frac{1}{T} = \frac{\omega}{2\pi}
}}$

{{$
a = -\omega^2x
}}$

== The Simple Harmonic Oscillator ==

Mass on a spring

{{$
ma = -kx
}}$

{{$
\omega^2 = \frac{k}{m}
}}$

{{$
\omega = \sqrt{\frac{k}{m}}
}}$

{{$
f = \frac{\omega}{2\pi} = \frac{1}{2\pi} \sqrt{\frac{k}{m}}
}}$

{{$
T = \frac{1}{f} = 2\pi \sqrt{\frac{m}{k}}
}}$

{{$
x = A\,\mathrm{cos}\left(\sqrt{\frac{m}{k}}t\right)
}}$

{{$
v = -\omega A\,\mathrm{sin}(\omega t)
}}$

== Kinetic Energy and Potential Energy ==

{{$
K = \frac{1}{2}mv^2 = \frac{1}{2}m[-\omega A\,\mathrm{sin}(\omega t)]^2 = \frac{1}{2}m\omega^2A^2\mathrm{sin}^2(\omega t)
}}$

{{$
m\omega^2 = k
}}$

{{$
K = \frac{1}{2}kA^2\mathrm{sin}^2(\omega t)
}}$

{{$
U = \frac{1}{2}kx^2 = \frac{1}{2}k[A\,\mathrm{cos}(\omega t)]^2 = \frac{1}{2}kA^2\mathrm{cos}^2(\omega t)
}}$

{{$
K + U = \frac{1}{2}kA^2\mathrm{sin}^2(\omega t) + \frac{1}{2}kA^2\mathrm{cos}^2(\omega t) = \frac{1}{2}kA^2(\mathrm{cos}^2(\omega t)+\mathrm{sin}^2(\omega t))
}}$

*Energy of a simple harmonic oscillator*

{{$
E = K + U = \frac{1}{2}kA^2
}}$

== The Simple Pendulum ==

{{$
I\alpha = \tau
}}$
Where $I$ is the moment of inertia and $\tau$ is the torque.

{{$
\tau = -mgl\,\mathrm{sin}\theta
}}$
Where $l$ is the length of the pendulum.

{{$
I = ml^2
}}$

{{$
l\alpha = -g\,\mathrm{sin}\theta
}}$

{{$
\omega = \sqrt{\frac{g}{l}}
}}$

{{$
f = \frac{\omega}{2\pi} = \frac{1}{2\pi}\sqrt{\frac{g}{l}}
}}$
